name: Arms
description:
Dian-Cui Loong-Soaring Bracers (Wukong's Fake Armor): unmissable, story-related. Automatically earned in Chapter 6. Note that this counts differently from the identically named arms piece #20.
Bull King's Bracers: can be crafted after defeating Bishui Golden-Eyed Beast at the end of Chapter 5's secret area. Requires Bull King's Iron Horns dropped by this boss (must beat it again in NG+ to craft full set). Another horn is found in chest in Chapter 5 Secret Area so be sure to grab this too. In order to craft the full set you will need New Game+ to get enough materials.
Golden Armguard: can be crafted after reaching the first Shrine in Chapter 4.
Pilgrim Wristwraps: can be crafted upon reaching the "Guanine Temple Shrine" in Chapter 1.
Yaksha Racers of Outrage: can be crafted after reaching the first Shrine in Chapter 6.
Iron-Tough Gauntlets: can be crafted after challenging and defeating the Yin Tiger blacksmith in Zodiac Village. Must have done Chen Loong questline to reach Zodiac Village.
Centipede Spiked Armguard: can be crafted after reaching the first Shrine in Chapter 5.
Non-Pure Gauntlets: can be crafted after defeating Zhu Bajie boss in Chapter 4.
Venomous Armguard: Chapter 4 > Webbed Hollow > Pool of Shattered Jade: HIGHLY MISSABLE. You must break off at least 4 arms during the 1st Venom Daoist boss in Chapter 4. You must attack its back or use the Wind Tamer Vessel for this. Only attack its back and make sure you're not as powerful to kill him before the 4th arm breaks off. See Venom Daoist location video.
Vajra Armguard: Chapter 3 > New Thunderclap Temple > Temple Entrance: from the Shrine, go right and immediately continue on the path on your left. Go past the Blind Monk and down the next staircase on your right with the two lightning-casting mages. Go to the next area where you'll find a "Clay Vajra" enemy in the middle of a small area. You must farm this enemy for this rare drop. It's a 4-legged creature that shoots fire from its stomach.
Insect Spike Bracers: can be crafted after defeating Fuban boss in Chapter 2 Secret Area.
Loongscale Armguard: can be crafted after defeating Kang-Jin Star boss in Chapter 3's Turtle Island.
Ochre Armguard: can be crafted after reaching the first Shrine in Chapter 3.
Folk Opera Leather Bracers: exclusive to the Deluxe Edition of the game. If owned, it can be crafted at the first Shrine of the game. Not necessary for the trophy.
Galguard Bracers: can be crafted after defeating the Stone Vanguard boss in Chapter 2.
Ebongold Armguard: can be crafted when reaching the first Shrine in Chapter 2.
Bronze Armguard: can be crafted after defeating Elder Jinchi boss in Chapter 1 Secret area.
Serpentscale Bracers: can be crafted after defeating White Clad Noble in Chapter 1.
Guanyin's Prayer Beads: Secret Area: Ancient Guanyin Temple > Grand Chamber: from the Shrine, open the chest right of it.
Dian-Cui Loong-Soaring Bracers (Wukong's True Armor): Chapter 6 > Foothills > Verdant Path. From the Shrine, turn left 90° and you'll see a mountain at the end of the path. Fly on the cloud (  +  /  +  – unlocked after "Supreme Inspector" Boss), land on this mountain to find a small golden chest that contains this secret armor set. See Video Guide. Note that this is counted separately from the identically named armor piece obtained from the Chapter 6 bosses.
Cotton Wristwraps: you start the game with this armor piece.

name: Body
description:
Gold Suozi Armor (Wukong's Fake Armor): unmissable, story-related. Automatically earned in Chapter 6. Note that this counts differently from the identically named body armor #19.
Bull King's Shan Wen Armor: can be crafted after defeating Bishui Golden-Eyed Beast at the end of Chapter 5's secret area. Requires Bull King's Iron Horns dropped by this boss (must beat it again in NG+ to craft full set). Another horn is found in chest in Chapter 5 Secret Area so be sure to grab this too. In order to craft the full set you will need New Game+ to get enough materials.
Pilgrim's Garb: can be crafted upon reaching the "Guanine Temple Shrine" in Chapter 1.
Embroidered Shirt of Outrage: can be crafted after reaching the first Shrine in Chapter 6.
Iron-Tough Armor: can be crafted after challenging and defeating the Yin Tiger blacksmith in Zodiac Village. Must have done Chen Loong questline to reach Zodiac Village.
Centipede Qiang-Jin Armor: can be crafted after reaching the first Shrine in Chapter 5.
Venomous Sting Insect Armor: can be crafted after defeating the Scorpionlord boss in Chapter 4 Secret Area.
Non-Pure Armor of Coiling Loong: can be crafted after defeating Zhu Bajie boss in Chapter 4.
Golden Embroidered Shirt: can be crafted after reaching the first Shrine in Chapter 4.
Loongscale Battlerobe: can be crafted after defeating Kang-Jin Star boss in Chapter 3's Turtle Island.
Folk Opera Almsgiving Armor: exclusive to the Deluxe Edition of the game. If owned, it can be crafted at the first Shrine of the game. Not necessary for the trophy.
Yin-Yang Daoist Robe: automatically earned for defeating the Keeper of Flaming Mountains story boss during Chapter 5.
Ochre Battlerobe: can be crafted after reaching the first Shrine in Chapter 3.
Ginseng Cape: Chapter 3 > Valley of Ecstasy > Towers of Karma: from the Shrine, go behind it and past the enemy facing the wall and continue to the stone pillar. Gather the ginseng plant in the middle and defeat the Old Ginseng Guai boss for this guaranteed drop.
Galeguard Beastmaw Armor: can be crafted after defeating the Stone Vanguard boss in Chapter 2.
Ebongold Silk Robe: can be crafted when reaching the first Shrine in Chapter 2.
Bronze Brocade Battlerobe: can be crafted after defeating Elder Jinchi boss in Chapter 1 Secret area.
Serpentscale Battlerobe: can be crafted after defeating Whiteclad Noble in Chapter 1.
Gold Suozi Armor (Wukong's True Armor): Chapter 6 > Foothills > Verdant Path. From the Shrine, turn left 90° and you'll see a mountain at the end of the path. Fly on the cloud (  +  /  +  – unlocked after "Supreme Inspector" Boss), land on this mountain to find a small golden chest that contains this secret armor set. See Video Guide. Note that this is counted separately from the identically named armor piece obtained from the Chapter 6 bosses.
Tiger Hide Loincloth: you start the game with this armor piece.

name: Cotton Legwraps: You Start The Game With This Armor Piece.
Cotton Wristwraps: You Start The Game With This Armor Piece.
Headgear
description:
Golden Feng-Tail Crown (Wukong's Fake Armor): unmissable, story-related. Automatically earned in Chapter 6. Note that this counts differently from the identically named headgear #19.
Bull King's Mask: can be crafted after defeating Bishui Golden-Eyed Beast at the end of Chapter 5 Secret Area. Requires Bull King's Iron Horns dropped by this boss (must beat it again in NG+ to craft full set). Another horn is found in chest in Chapter 5 Secret Area so be sure to grab this too. In order to craft the full set you will need New Game+ to get enough materials.
Golden Mask of Fury: can be crafted after reaching the first Shrine in Chapter 4.
Pilgrim's Headband: can be crafted upon reaching the "Guanyin Temple Shrine" in Chapter 1.
Folk Opera Mask: exclusive to the Deluxe Edition of the game. If owned, it can be crafted at the first Shrine of the game. Not necessary for the trophy.
Yaksha Mask of Outrage: can be crafted after reaching the first Shrine in Chapter 6.
Iron Horned Helm: can be crafted after challenging and defeating the Yin Tiger blacksmith in Zodiac Village. Must have done Chen Loong questline to reach Zodiac Village.
Centipede Hat of Transcendence: can be crafted after reaching the first Shrine in Chapter 5.
Non-Pure Broken Mask: can be crafted after defeating Zhu Bajie boss in Chapter 4.
Monastic Insect Hat: can be crafted after defeating Fuban boss in Chapter 2 Secret Area.
Earth Spirit Cap: Chapter 5 > Filed of Fire > Ashen Pass III: from the Shrine, go behind it and gather the big mushroom in the middle. Defeat the Nine-Capped Lingzhi Guai boss for this guaranteed drop.
Skull of Turtle Treasure: Chapter 5 > Woods of Ember > Height of Ember: from the Shrine, continue on past the gate and down the hill where you'll eventually will find this big mouse-masked enemy. You must farm this enemy for this rare drop.
Locust Antennae Mask: Chapter 4 > Webbed Hollow > Upper Hollow: from the Shrine, go up the stairs and then continue left to find a locust enemy spawning from a cocoon. You must farm this enemy for this rare drop.
See No Evil: Chapter 3 > New Thunderclap Temple > Temple Entrance: from the Shrine, go down the stairs and enter the first building. Here you must farm the Blind Monk enemies for this rare drop. There are several other monks in the area that you can all kill for a chance to get this.
Galeguard Beast Mask: can be crafted after defeating the Stone Vanguard boss in Chapter 2.
Bronze Monkey Mask: can be crafted after defeating Elder Jinchi boss in Chapter 1 Secret area.
Snout Mask: dropped by the "Yellow-Robed Squire" boss you fight as part of the Drunken Boar questline in Chapter 2.
Grey Wolf Mask: earned for defeating Lingxuzi boss in Chapter 1.
Golden Feng-Tail Crown (Wukong's True Armor): Chapter 6 > Foothills > Verdant Path. From the Shrine, turn left 90° and you'll see a mountain at the end of the path. Fly on the cloud (  +  /  +  – unlocked after "Supreme Inspector" Boss), land on this mountain to find a small golden chest that contains this secret armor set. See Video Guide. Note that this is counted separately from the identically named armor piece obtained from the Chapter 6 bosses.

name: Legs
description:
Lotus Silk Cloudtreaders (Wukong's Fake Armor): unmissable, story-related. Automatically earned in Chapter 6. Note that this counts differently from the identically named legs armor #17.
Bull King's Greaves: can be crafted after defeating Bishui Golden-Eyed Beast at the end of Chapter 5's secret area. Requires Bull King's Iron Horns dropped by this boss (must beat it again in NG+ to craft full set). Another horn is found in chest in Chapter 5 Secret Area so be sure to grab this too. In order to craft the full set you will need New Game+ to get enough materials.
Pilgrim's Legwraps: can be crafted upon reaching the "Guanine Temple Shrine" in Chapter 1.
Yaksha Greaves of Outrage: can be crafted after reaching the first Shrine in Chapter 6.
Iron-Tough Greaves: can be crafted after challenging and defeating the Yin Tiger blacksmith in Zodiac Village. Must have done Chen Loong questline to reach Zodiac Village.
Centipede Greaves of Transcendence: can be crafted after reaching the first Shrine in Chapter 5.
Non-Pure Greaves: can be crafted after defeating Zhu Bajie boss in Chapter 4.
Golden Greaves: can be crafted after reaching the first Shrine in Chapter 4.
Insect Spike Greaves: can be crafted after defeating Fuban boss in Chapter 2 Secret Area.
Loongscale Greaves: can be crafted after defeating Kang-Jin Star boss in Chapter 3's Turtle Island.
Ochre Greaves: can be crafted after reaching the first Shrine in Chapter 3.
Folk Opera Buskins: exclusive to the Deluxe Edition of the game. If owned, it can be crafted at the first Shrine of the game. Not necessary for the trophy.
Galeguard Grevaes: can be crafted after defeating the Stone Vanguard boss in Chapter 2.
Ebongold Gaiters: can be crafted when reaching the first Shrine in Chapter 2.
Bronze Buskins: can be crafted after defeating Elder Jinchi boss in Chapter 1 Secret area.
Serpentscale Gaiters: can be crafted after defeating White Clad Noble in Chapter 1.
Lotus Silk Cloudtreaders (Wukong's True Armor): Chapter 6 > Foothills > Verdant Path. From the Shrine, turn left 90° and you'll see a mountain at the end of the path. Fly on the cloud (  +  /  +  – unlocked after "Supreme Inspector" Boss), land on this mountain to find a small golden chest that contains this secret armor set. See Video Guide. Note that this is counted separately from the identically named armor piece obtained from the Chapter 6 bosses.
Cotton Legwraps: you start the game with this armor piece.
These are all the Armor Locations in Black Myth Wukong.
For all other collectibles check out Black Myth Wukong 100% Wiki.

name: Tiger Hide Loincloth: You Start The Game With This Armor Pie
